result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Muehleck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: all cases.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Sign all releases for Agent.

No contact with Diane Muehleck unless approved by both Diane M. and Agent.
No contact with Sarah Lartz and Patrick McVey.
Cognative Intervension Programing.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Detainer Cancellation

Defendant Michael J Muehleck in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Paul Jakus.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court and parties address the PSI. State makes recommendations.  Attorney Jakus makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed Sentence of:

10 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days ) Concurrent to all cases

6 Years of Initial Confinement

4 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Diane Muehleck unless approved by both Diane M. and agent

No contact with Sarah Lartz and Patrick McVey

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

Cognative Intervension programming

Sign all releases for agent

No Use or Possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Cost: $268.00 to be paid as a condition of supervision

DNA surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of supervision

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
